rdlabel.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Routine: ReadLabel
00004  
00005   Description: Reads in a PDS label and places the label information
00006                into an ODL tree.
00007  
00008   Input:
00009           input_file - Pointer to the file containing the label.
00010           root       - Pointer to the root node on the ODL parse tree.
00011  
00012   Output: A value of one is returned as the function value if parsing was
00013           completed successfully; otherwise a value of zero is returned
00014           and an summary of errors and warnings is given.
00015  
00016   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00017 
00018   Creation Date:  20 March 1989
00019   Last Modified:  18 May 1991
00020 
00021   History:
00022  
00023     Creation - This routine was part of Version 1 of the ODLC library.
00024 
00025     Version 2.0 - 10 October 1990 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00026       a) Modified to be compatible with Version 2 data structures.
00027       b) Changed to use ODLPrintError for output rather than putting
00028          error messages direct to the terminal.
00029       c) Moved global variable definitions to the parser action module.
00030 
00031     Version 2.1 - 13 March 1991, R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00032       a) Set the new global variable ODLlinenumber_flag to TRUE to
00033          indicate that line numbers should be included in any
00034          error or warning messages.
00035 
00036   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00037     a) Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00038        in odldef.h. Added include file odlinter.h.
00039     b) Added pds_line_offset to line number to account for SFDU skipping.
00040 
00041 *****************************************************************************/
00042 
00043 #include "odldef.h"
00044 #include "odlinter.h"
00045 
00046 /* The following statements duplicate two lexical analyzer constants for
00047    use in this module */
00048 
00049 #define YYLMAX BUFSIZ
00050 #define YYNEWLINE 10
00051 
00052 /* The following variables are defined in the module containing the
00053    parser action routines. */
00054 
00055 extern AGGREGATE  ODLroot_node;         /* Pointer to root node of ODL tree */
00056 extern AGGREGATE  ODLcurrent_aggregate; /* Pointer to current aggregate node*/
00057 
00058 /* The following variables are defined with the output routines
00059    ODLPrintError and ODLPrintWarning */
00060 
00061 extern int        ODLerror_count;       /* Cumulative count of errors       */
00062 extern int        ODLwarning_count;     /* Cumulative count of warnings     */
00063 extern int        ODLlinenumber_flag;   /* Controls output of line nos.     */
00064 
00065 /* The following variables are defined in the lexical analyzer module */
00066 
00067 extern FILE *yyin;                  /* Pointer to file for parser input     */
00068 extern FILE *yyout;                 /* Pointer to file for parser output    */
00069 
00070 extern char  yysbuf[YYLMAX];        /* Lexical analysis rescan buffer       */
00071 extern char *yysptr;                /* Pointer into lexical rescan buffer   */
00072 
00073 extern int   yylineno;              /* Current input line number            */
00074 extern int   yyprevious;            /* Previous lexical analysis state      */
00075 
00076 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00077 
00078 extern int  pds_line_offset;        /* SFDU offset for PDS toolbox          */
00079 
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 int ReadLabel (
00083 
00084      FILE     *input_file,
00085      AGGREGATE  root)
00086 
00087 {
00088   char  warning[120];               /* String to contain warning message    */
00089 
00090 
00091   /* Set pointers for the files to be used by the parser */
00092 
00093   yyin  = input_file;
00094   yyout = NULL;
00095 
00096   /* Reset other variables used by the lexical analyzer */
00097 
00098   yyprevious = YYNEWLINE;
00099   yysptr = yysbuf;
00100   yylineno = 1;
00101 
00102 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00103 
00104    yylineno += pds_line_offset;
00105 
00106 #endif
00107 
00108   /* Initialize the error and warning counters and indicate that line
00109      numbers are to appear in all error and warning messages */
00110 
00111   ODLerror_count       = 0;
00112   ODLwarning_count     = 0;
00113   ODLlinenumber_flag   = 1;
00114 
00115   /* Initialize the node pointers */
00116 
00117   ODLroot_node         = root;
00118   ODLcurrent_aggregate = root;
00119   
00120   /* Call the parser to read in and process the label */
00121 
00122   if (yyparse() != 0)
00123   {
00124     sprintf (warning,
00125              "Label reading complete with %d errors, %d warnings.",
00126              ODLerror_count,
00127              ODLwarning_count);
00128     ODLPrintWarning (warning);
00129     return (0);
00130   }
00131   else
00132   {
00133     return (1);
00134   }
00135 }
